intro: Microstylis dolichostachys, commonly known as the long-stalked microstylis, is a small herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. The plant features slender, grass-like stems and produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in dense clusters. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often growing in dense tufts. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks.
